business.headline: Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Financial crisis looms in Delhi as extra spending tips city into revenue deficitSeveral departments have underscored additional resource needs, which strain the budget further.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as foreign investment fizzles; Tata Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 230.05 points to close at 81,381.36, while the Nifty50 declined by 34.20 points to end at 24,964.25.
Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

Rupee falls to all-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Online guide to check statusGaruda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Investors who have bid for the IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Ratan Tata was a great human being, very humble: Narayana MurthyIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy paid tribute to late industrialist, Ratan Tata. Murthy lauded Ratan Tata as a 'compassionate human being who transcended financial status and official power.'

Ratan Tata's legacy as humanitarian bigger than as industrialist: Birla Group chiefIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Kumar Mangalam Birla, chairperson of the Aditya Birla Group, reflected on the life and legacy of Ratan Tata.
TCS Q2 Results: IT firm's net profit up 5% YoY to Rs 11,909 crore The company's net profit reached Rs 11,909 crore, up from Rs 11,342 crore in the same period last year.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally higher; banking, metal stocks shine The S&P BSE Sensex added 144.31 points to close at 81,611.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 16.50 points to end at 24,998.45.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Justin Trudeau says met PM Modi in Laos: Real issues we need to solveAccording to Trudeau, he spoke to PM Modi about the "work that we need to do", alluding to the strained ties between the two nations after he alleged New Delhi's involvement in the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar last year.

600 Indian soldiers at risk, Delhi flags concern after Israel attack on UN postsIndia's statement came a day after the UN said the Naqoura headquarters of the United Nations Interim Force In Lebanon (UNIFIL) and nearby positions have been repeatedly hit by Israeli forces.

All about Nihon Hidankyo, the Japanese group awarded Nobel Peace PrizeNihon Hidankyo's primary mission is to advocate for the abolition of nuclear weapons, support the welfare of atomic bomb survivors, and raise awareness about the devastation caused by nuclear warfare.

Video: Elon Musk takes a ride in Tesla's self-driving robotaxiUS car-making giant Tesla has shared a video of its owner and billionaire Elon Musk riding the new Robotaxi. In the video, one can see that the car's automated doors open as soon as Musk approaches the vehicle, he sits inside and makes himself comfortable.

Karnataka government withdraws 2022 Hubballi riot cases against AIMIM leadersThe Congress-led Karnataka government has decided to withdraw criminal cases against AIMIM leaders who were accused of leading a mob that attacked the police and threatened to break into the police station in Hubballi in 2022.

Voluntarily retiring hurt to be deemed out: BCCI revamps Domestic cricket rulesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India has opted to make major changes in domestic cricket. One of the main changes states that batters who retire voluntarily will be deemed out unless they are injured.
2 Agniveers killed as artillery shell burst during firing exercise in MaharashtraThe Agniveers had come from Hyderabad for training at Artillery School in Deolali, Nashik in Maharashtra.

Jigra review: Alia Bhatt's sparkle can't save this dull filmReleased-Fri Oct 11, 2024Alia Bhatt-starrer Jigra has promise, and the lead star shines brightest in the Vasan Bala directorial. However, the storyline leaves us wanting. Read the complete review of the film here.

CCTV captures theft of Kali crown gifted by PM Modi to Bangladesh templeA crown gifted by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the Jeshoreshwari Kali Temple in Satkhira in Bangladesh, has been stolen. The silver, gold-plated crown, presented during Modi's visit in 2021, was stolen on Thursday afternoon after the temple priest left following worship. CCTV footage captured a man stealing the crown.

Meanwhile, India has expressed its concern over the incident and urged the Bangladesh government to recover the stolen crown and bring the culprits to justice. Police said they are analysing the CCTV footage to identify the suspect.

Hezbollah using UN posts as shields: Israel's response on attacks at peacekeepersResponding to India's comments on the attacks at the UN peacekeeping headquarters in southern Lebanon, Israeli envoy, Reuven Azar, said that Hezbollah is firing at Israel in proximity to UNIFIL outposts, criminally using them as a shield.

Nayab Saini likely to take oath as Haryana Chief Minister on October 15: SourcesBJP's Nayab Singh Saini is likely to take oath as the Haryana Chief Minister on October 15, sources said, days after the BJP secured a stunning hat-trick in the Assembly polls, winning 48 seats in the 90-member House.
Aurora lights up Leh skies as geomagnetic storm hits EarthSkies in Leh, Ladakh were lit up by a rare aurora borealis due to a strong geomagnetic storm that reached Earth on Thursday.

A tale of sugar and milk: How Parsis found a home in IndiaIn the 8th century, a group of Zoroastrians, fleeing persecution in Persia (modern-day Iran), arrived at the coast of Gujarat, seeking refuge. The Indian King of Sanjan allowed the strangers to stay on his land. The migrants promised to blend in, like sugar in milk, which has been the hallmark of their relationship with India.

When PM brought Nano plant to Gujarat after 1 word SMS to Ratan Tata in 2008Then Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi had sent a one word SMS to the then Tata Group Chairman Ratan Tata after the Nano project was withdrawn from West Bengal in 2008.

The Kashmir story is much bigger than BJP's fortunesThe present and future of Kashmir matters more than the fortunes of political parties. That a free-and-fair election was held in Jammu and Kashmir and saw enthusiastic participation by the people is much more significant than the electoral outcome. This is why the process, and not its performance, should enthuse the BJP.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
